addressleaf.section:
To my verie Lovinge frend M
r
Thomas Bodley esquier Counsellor of estate for her ma
tie
in the united Provinces of the Lowe Countries

3 Decem
b
89 S
r
Francis Walsingham copy of the
Quenes
l
re
for my
L Burghes
repaire hence.

page.lettertext:
After my very hartie commendations. The Queenes Ma
tie
understanding of the diseased state of the Lord Boroughes helth
and for his recovery of the same, having granted unto him her gracious
licence to com into
England
for a season, So as he co
m
ytt the charge of
the
Brill
to som such parson as his L. should think most meete and
sufficient for the same and for whom he will aunswerr, during his
absence, hath bene pleased upon the naiming of
Capten Price
ther
u
to, that
he shall take the charge and governm
t
of that Town, during the L. Boroughes
absence. And therfore her pleas
r
is. That upon knowledge to be given unto
you by the L. Borowgh therof (as her Ma
tie
in her l
re
hath willed him so to do)
you shall notifie to the
Counsell of State
there, the naming of the said cap
n
Price to that charge, as a parson whom her Ma
tie
doth allowe & appoynt
ther
u
to, for the tyme that the Lord Borowgh shall be absent. And bicause yo
w
may know what her Ma
tie
hath written to the L. Bo
r
I have thought
good to send yow heerw
t
a copie of her Highnes l
re
s unto him,
And so doo very hartely byd yo
u
farewell. From London the third of Dec
e
ber 1589
Yo
r
assured Looving frend
Francis Walsingham
